      • rememberGameData

        public void rememberGameData()
        Description copied from class: GorillasTestAdapterMinimal
        all the game data is stored. This method is needed to restore the game data after the testing. The term game data denotes every information, which the game saves between different runs (like settings and the chosen player names).

      • getNextShotPosition

        public org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f getNextShotPosition(org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f startPosition,
                                                           int angle,
                                                           int speed,
                                                           int wind,
                                                           int gravity,
                                                           boolean fromLeftToRight,
                                                           int deltaTime)
        Computes the next position of a throw. Your method has to evaluate the parameters as defined by the task description. You can choose your own wind and time scaling factors. The constraint is: The gameplay. This means on one hand, that the user does not have to wait for minutes till the shot either collides or leaves the screen (not too slow). On the other hand, the user has to be able to follow the shot with the eyes (not too fast). To ensure testability, please provide your wind and time scaling factors via GorillasTestAdapterExtended2.getWindScalingFactor() respectively GorillasTestAdapterMinimal.getTimeScalingFactor().
        Parameters:
        startPosition - the (x,y) start position of the shot. The upper left corner of the game screen is (0,0). The lower right corner of the game screen is (width of game screen, height of game screen).
        angle - the starting angle in degree from 0 to 360
        speed - the speed in a range from 0 to 200
        wind - the wind speed on a scale from -15 to 15, whereas -15 means strong wind from right to left and 15 means strong wind from left to right
        gravity - the gravity on a scale from 0 to 20
        deltaTime - the time passed in ms
        fromLeftToRight - true if the shot was fired by the left player and thus moves from left to right, otherwise false
        Returns:
        the next position of the shot
